str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To delay, tarry, linger, spend time. From chronos; to take time, i.e. Linger.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To come, go.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
To beat, strike, wound, inflict punishment.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Perhaps from paio; a boy, or, a girl, and a child; specially, a slave or servant.
And, even, also, namely.
A female slave, maidservant, maid, young girl. Feminine diminutive of pais; a girl, i.e., a female slave or servant.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.
And, even, also, namely.
To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To make drunk; pass: I become drunk. A prolonged form of methuo; to intoxicate.
